page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: Our D. block is 5 miles south of Newcastle and 1O miles north of Durham. It is crossed north, south by an important road which used to be the A.1. before the new road, the A69T was built. This new road keeps to the higher land to the east away from the town centre. Also running vertically across the area is the main East Coast Railway which uses the flat river valley of the River Team. The road is lined by factories shops and houses, most of the housing being found to the higher land in the east. The east is more heavily populated therefore than the west where most of the population live at Kibblesworth. Mixed farming is carried out in the central and western areas of D. block. The largest single industry is Durham Chemicals.
